document.masterDocTitle: A review of neococcid scale insects (Hemiptera: Sternorrhyncha: Coccomorpha) based on the morphology of the adult males

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of neococcid scale insects (Hemiptera: Sternorrhyncha: Coccomorpha) based on the morphology of the adult males

subSubSection.paragraph:
Stictococcus vayssierei Richard 1971
, 592. Type data:
Cameroon
, Yaound√© ,
on
Manihot esculenta
,
13/12/1969
. Holotype , first instar. Type depository: MNHN.

Material examined .
Paratypes
.
Cameroon
, Yaoundi, on
Manihot esculenta
, 13.xii.1969 , no collector ( MNHN 7611/4 & 5): 2/2ad ‚ôÇ‚ôÇ (good, except all wings missing and head twisted on one specimen).

Mounted material : small, total body length 1.10‚Äì1.15 mm ; antennae short, 7-segmented, less than one-third total body length; body setae few, probably mostly fs but these variable in size and hard to separate from hs. Wings missing on both specimens.

Head : appearing roughly oval; length about 120 Œºm; width across genae about 180 Œºm. Median crest (mc) not striated or reticulated; postoccipital ridge (por) present, posterior arms better defined that anterior arms; with (on each side) 5 fs (a few split at apex) + 2 or 3 hs. Mid-cranial ridge: dorsal ridge (dmcr) absent; ventral ridge (vmcr) long, extending almost to ocular sclerite (ocs) with well-developed lateral branches (lmcr); without any reticulations or striations laterally; with 0 or 1 fs ventral mid-cranial ridge seta (vmcrs) on each side. Genae (g) without reticulations; genal setae: 1 fs + 2 hs on each side laterad to postocular ridge. Eyes: with two pairs of round simple eyes; dorsal eyes (dse) near antennae, subequal in width to ventral eyes (vse), each 33‚Äì39 Œºm wide. Ocelli (o) pronounced, convex, 8‚Äì12 Œºm wide. Ocular sclerite (ocs) without polygonal reticulations but possibly with raised spots. Preocular ridge (procr) very small or absent. Postocular ridge (pocr) strongly developed, extending dorsally past posterior margin of each ocellus almost to postoccipital ridge; interocular ridge (ior) present, extending to base of each scape and passing just ventral to each dorsal eye. Dorsal ocular setae (docs) absent. Ventral head setae (vhs): 2 fs + 18 or 19 hs on each side, mainly anterior to ventral eyes but also laterad, between and posterior to eyes. Preoral ridge (pror) probably represented by a sclerotisation at base of cranial apophysis; cranial apophysis (ca) about 55 Œºm long and blunt apically.

Antennae : 7-segmented, total length 245‚Äì250 Œºm; fs and hs almost indistinguishable. Scape (scp): 28‚Äì34 Œºm long and 40 Œºm wide, with 5‚Äì7 setae. Pedicel (pdc): 21‚Äì30 Œºm long, 30 Œºm wide; with 4 or 5 setae + campaniform pore; Johnstone‚Äôs organ clearly present between pedicel and segment III. Fleshy setae 33‚Äì37 Œºm long. Segment III 53 Œºm wide distally and 84‚Äì86 Œºm long, with 9‚Äì13 setae; segment IV 36‚Äì45 Œºm long, with 14 or 15 setae; segment V 58‚Äì69 Œºm long, with 14‚Äì17 setae + 1 bristle; segment VI 36‚Äì50 Œºm long, with 16 or 17 setae + 1 bristle; seg- ment VII almost round, 26‚Äì28 Œºm long, with 5 bristles (3 long and 2 short), 1 seta + 3 capitate setae. No sensilla basiconica detected.

Thorax . Prothorax : pronotal ridge (prnr) well-developed but not fused dorsally; lateral pronotal sclerite (prn) narrow; without lateral pronotal (lpns) setae. Medial pronotal setae, post-tergites and post-tergital setae absent. Sternum (stn 1 ) not sclerotised and lacking a median sclerotised ridge but with a quite strong transverse ridge; with 1 or 2 fs + 2 or 3 hs prosternal setae (stn 1 s) on each side; extending anteriorly past procoxae (anteprosternal setae (astn 1 s)? Antemesospiracular setae (am 2 s) absent.

Mesothorax : prescutum (prsc) oval, 41‚Äì43 Œºm long, 74‚Äì81 Œºm wide; with large nodulations/reticulations throughout; prescutal ridges (pscr) and prescutal suture (pscs) ill-defined or absent; with 2 fs prescutal setae (pscs) near each lateral margin. Scutum (sct) sclerotised medially, with an area of narrow reticulations bordering prescutum and laterad to scutellum; median area 50‚Äì55 Œºm long; with 1‚Äì4 fs scutal setae (scts) on each side plus 0‚Äì5 anterolaterally; lateral margins not reticulated. Prealare ridge fairly weak. Scutellum (scl) 124 Œºm wide, 33 Œºm long; possibly tubular, with a large foramen; with 1 fs + 1 or 2 hs scutellar setae (scls) on each side; scutum laterad to scutellum polygonally reticulated. Basisternum (stn 2 ) 157‚Äì186 Œºm wide, 61 Œºm long; without a median ridge (mdr), but bounded anteriorly by a strong marginal ridge (mr) and posteriorly by strong precoxal ridges (pcr 2 ); with 27‚Äì29 fs basisternal setae (stn 2 s); lateropleurite (lpl) narrow with a strong extension from marginal ridge anteriorly; with 1 fs + 1 hs on or near lateral margin of lateropleurite; furca (f) well developed, narrow-waisted, arms very divergent and extending almost to marginal ridge. Mesopostnotum (pn 2 ) normally developed; postnotal apophysis (pna) well developed. Area bounded anteriorly by scutellum and laterally and posteriorly by mesopostnotum not sclerotised. Mesepisternum (eps 2 ) not reticulated but with 3 or 4 fs/hs mesepisternal setae (eps 2 s); subepisternal ridge well developed. Postalare (pa) not reticulated anteriorly; without postalare setae (pas). Mesothoracic spiracle (sp 2 ): peritreme 20‚Äì22 Œºm wide. Postme- sospiracular setae (pm 2 s): 1 or 2 present just posterior to each mesothoracic spiracle. Tegula (teg) present, with 1‚Äì3 fs tegular setae (tegs) on each side.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 52.
Stictococcus vayssierei Richard. Macropterous
male. ( Stictococcidae ). Where L=loculate pore. Where A=cranial apophysis, E=divided hair-like seta and L=loculate pore.

subSubSection.paragraph: Legs : legs subequal in length. Coxae (cx): I 66‚Äì70; II 62‚Äì67; III 70 Œºm long; setae of coxa III: 8‚Äì12; apical setae on each coxa short, 35‚Äì38 Œºm. Trochanter (tr) + femur (fm): I 165‚Äì182; II 153‚Äì174; III 140‚Äì187 Œºm long; trochanter III setae: 2‚Äì4; long trochanter long seta up to 45 Œºm; femur III setae: 19‚Äì26. Tibia (ti): I 120‚Äì137; II 120‚Äì145; III 107‚Äì140 Œºm; tibia III setae: 12‚Äì22 fs and hs; with two distinct apical spurs (tibs), each 34‚Äì36 Œºm long. Tarsi (ta): I 70‚Äì83; II 66‚Äì83; III 53‚Äì75 Œºm long (ratio of length of tibia III to tarsus III 1:0.52); tarsus III setae: 10‚Äì16; tarsal campaniform pore present; each tarsus with 2 distinct tarsal spurs, each 26‚Äì28 Œºm long; tarsal digitules (tdt) unusual, as in family diagnosis. Claws (c) also of unusual shape, see family diagnosis; length: III 35‚Äì43 Œºm; claw digitules (cdt) slightly longer than claw, with minute apical knobs.

Abdomen : segments I‚ÄìVII: tergites (at) all lightly sclerotised; sternites (as) slightly more sclerotised than tergites. Caudal extension (ce) of segment VII absent. Dorsal setae (ads) (on each side): segments I‚ÄìIV each with 1‚Äì4 fs + 0‚Äì4 hs; V‚ÄìVII each with 4 fs + 0‚Äì2 hs. Pleural setae: dorsopleural + ventropleural setae (on each side): I‚ÄìVII each with 2‚Äì4 (fs?). Ventral setae (avs) (on each side): II with 2‚Äì10 fs + 0 hs; III‚ÄìVII each with 2‚Äì4 fs + 1‚Äì8 hs.

Segment VIII: tergite (at) distinctly sclerotised, with 1 fs + 0 or 1 hs dorsal abdominal setae (ads) on each side; sternite (as) distinctly sclerotised, with 0 fs + 6‚Äì9 hs ventral abdominal setae (avs); caudal extension (ce) rounded but with 2 or 3 hs long pleural setae, each 46‚Äì66 Œºm long + 2 shorter hs. Glandular pouches (gp) absent.

Genital segments : segment IX broad and heavily sclerotised; length 114‚Äì117 Œºm, width at anterior margin 97‚Äì108 Œºm; anus 43‚Äì50 Œºm long, 28‚Äì30Œºm wide; with 2 or 3 pairs of hs ventro-laterally, each 50‚Äì55 Œºm long. Style separated from segment IX by a narrow membrane; style bulbous at anterior end, rapidly narrowing and then long with a fine apex; style 232‚Äì265 Œºm long; 36‚Äì42 Œºm wide at base; with 1 pair of long hs dorso-laterally on anterior bulbous part plus 1 pair half-way along shaft, each 63‚Äì72 Œºm long; also with a pair of small pores on apex and an- other pair just over half-way along penial sheath. Aedeagus 245 Œºm long, extending from posterior part of segment IX; as broad as penial sheath anteriorly, not bulbous but gradually narrowing to a fine apex and therefore broader than penial sheath along much of its length; basal rod broad distally and not apparently extending posteriorly down aedeagus.

Comment. For differences from
S. intermedius
, see key above.
